author: "Jeffrey Scott Racine"
date: now
date-format: "YYYY-MM-DD"
# quarto add pandoc-ext/multibib
# Disable Quarto's global citeproc; enable citeproc per-format and use multibib for bibliography handling.
# NOTE: A `pdf` output block is configured below; printing the HTML to PDF via headless Chrome is an alternative workflow if preferred.
citeproc: false
# Add multibib filter
filters:
  - multibib
validate-yaml: false
# Define your bibliography files with specific IDs
bibliography:
  articles: publications-peer-reviewed-articles.bib
  books: publications-books.bib
  reviews: publications-reviews.bib
  edited: publications-edited.bib
  packages: publications-packages.bib
format:
  pdf:
    latex-engine: xelatex
    keep-tex: true
    citeproc: true
    citation-style: numeric-ydnt.csl
    nocite: "@*"
    geometry: "margin=1in"
    include-in-header:
      - text: |
          \usepackage{newtxtext}
          \usepackage{microtype}
          \renewenvironment{CSLReferences}[2]{%
            \begin{list}{}{%
              \setlength{\labelwidth}{\csllabelwidth}%
              \setlength{\labelsep}{0.5em}%
              % Shift labels 0.1in right (less negative offset) while keeping wrapped lines aligned under the entry text
              \setlength{\leftmargin}{\dimexpr\labelwidth+\labelsep+\cslhangindent-28pt\relax}%
              \setlength{\itemindent}{-12pt}%
              \setlength{\parsep}{0pt}%
              \setlength{\itemsep}{#2\baselineskip}}}%
          {\end{list}}
          \makeatother
  html:
    toc: true
    css: cv.css
    citation-style: numeric-ydnt.csl
    reference-section-title: ""
    nocite: "@*"
    citeproc: true
    include-in-header:
      - text: |
          <link rel="stylesheet" href="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/font-awesome/6.4.0/css/all.min.css">
          <link rel="stylesheet" href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/academicons@latest/css/academicons.min.css">
          <style>
            /* Small R logo alignment */
            .r-logo svg{ display:inline-block; vertical-align: -0.12em; margin-right: .5rem }
            /* Icons: add spacing to emulate NBSP in HTML only (won't affect PDF) */
            i[class*="fa-"], i[class*="ai-"]{ margin-right: .35rem; vertical-align: -0.12em; display:inline-block }
            /* Package link icons */
            #refs-packages .csl-entry a { text-decoration: none }
            .pkg-icon { margin-left: .35rem; vertical-align: middle; display: inline-block }
            /* Slightly reduce list indent for package section (preserves R logo alignment) */
            #refs-packages.csl-bib-body { padding-left: 0.5rem }
            /* Apply the same reduced indent to other bibliography sections so markers line up */
            #refs-books.csl-bib-body,
            #refs-edited.csl-bib-body,
            #refs-articles.csl-bib-body,
            #refs-reviews.csl-bib-body { padding-left: 0.5rem }

          </style>
          <script>
            document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', function(){
              const pkgDiv = document.getElementById('refs-packages');
              if(pkgDiv){
                pkgDiv.querySelectorAll('.csl-entry a').forEach(function(a){
                  const href = a.getAttribute('href') || '';
                  const next = a.nextSibling;
                  // For DOI links: do not insert link icons (they caused layout/clobbering issues).
                  // For CRAN package DOIs (doi.org/...CRAN.package...), append the R logo (no link icon) and avoid inserting duplicates.
                  // Non-DOI links are left as-is.
                  if(href.includes('doi.org')){
                    // Do not insert link icons (they caused layout/clobbering issues).
                    // For CRAN package DOIs, still append the R logo (no link icon).
                    if(href.includes('CRAN.package')){
                      const afterNode = next;
                      if(!(afterNode && afterNode.classList && afterNode.classList.contains('pkg-icon'))){
                        const rimg = document.createElement('img');
                        rimg.src = 'r-logo.png';
                        rimg.alt = 'CRAN';
                        rimg.className = 'pkg-icon';
                        rimg.style.width = '16px'; rimg.style.height = '16px';
                        a.parentNode.insertBefore(rimg, afterNode);
                      }
                    }
                  }
                });

                // Remove any existing link icons (fa-link) that may have been added previously
                pkgDiv.querySelectorAll('i.fa-link').forEach(function(ic){ ic.remove(); });

                // Hide long URL anchors when a DOI is present to reduce clutter
                function hidePackageURLs(){
                  let removedAny = false;
                  pkgDiv.querySelectorAll('.csl-entry').forEach(function(entry){
                    const hasDOI = !!entry.querySelector('a[href*="doi.org"]');
                    if(!hasDOI) return;
                    entry.querySelectorAll('a').forEach(function(a){
                      const href = a.getAttribute('href') || '';
                      // hide non-doi http/https links (these are the long URLs)
                      if(href.startsWith('http') && !href.includes('doi.org')){
                        // remove preceding 'URL:' label if present
                        const prev = a.previousSibling;
                        if(prev && prev.nodeType === Node.TEXT_NODE){
                          prev.textContent = prev.textContent.replace(/\,?\s*URL\s*:\s*/i, '');
                        }
                        a.remove();
                        removedAny = true;
                      }
                    });
                  });
                  return removedAny;
                }
                // Try immediately and observe for dynamic changes (citeproc may insert anchors later)
                if(!hidePackageURLs()){
                  const urlObserver = new MutationObserver(function(mutations, obs){
                    if(hidePackageURLs()) obs.disconnect();
                  });
                  urlObserver.observe(pkgDiv, { childList: true, subtree: true });
                }
              }

              // Remove leading numeric prefixes from csl bibliography entries and render them as native list items
              function stripBibliographyNumbers(){
                let changed = false;
                document.querySelectorAll('.references.csl-bib-body').forEach(function(bib){
                  bib.querySelectorAll('.csl-entry').forEach(function(entry){
                    // First try to remove any leading numeric prefixes directly from innerHTML
                    const oldHTML = entry.innerHTML || '';
                    const newHTML = oldHTML.replace(/^\s*\d+\.\s*/, '');
                    if(newHTML !== oldHTML){
                      entry.innerHTML = newHTML;
                      changed = true;
                      return;
                    }
                    // Fallback: scan child text nodes for leading numeric prefix
                    entry.childNodes.forEach(function(n){
                      if(n.nodeType === Node.TEXT_NODE){
                        const t = n.textContent || '';
                        const nt = t.replace(/^\s*\d+\.\s*/, '');
                        if(nt !== t){
                          n.textContent = nt;
                          changed = true;
                        }
                      }
                    });
                  });
                });
                return changed;
              }

              // Run immediately; observe if citeproc inserts entries later
              if(!stripBibliographyNumbers()){
                const bibObserver = new MutationObserver(function(muts, obs){
                  if(stripBibliographyNumbers()) obs.disconnect();
                });
                document.querySelectorAll('.references.csl-bib-body').forEach(function(b){ bibObserver.observe(b, { childList: true, subtree: true }); });
              }
            });
          </script>
params:
  # If true, runs Google Scholar queries during rendering (requires network access and packages like `gcite`/`scholar`); set to `false` to avoid live network lookups.
  gseval: true
  # Spacing parameters for CV layout (tweak to control global spacing)
  #
  # Documentation:
  #   - Edit the values under `params.spacing.value` to adjust global spacing
  #     without editing `cv.css` directly.
  #   - `body_line_height` (unitless): typical range 1.15–1.5; 1.5 gives an
  #     airy look. Use smaller values (1.1–1.3) for denser CVs.
  #   - `bib_line_height`: adjusts bibliography line height (suggest 1.1–1.4).
  #   - `bib_gap`, `list_gap`, `list_item_gap`, `paragraph_gap`: use CSS length
  #     values (e.g., "0.12em", "0.85em"). Smaller values tighten spacing.
  #   - After editing params, re-render (`quarto render`) to apply the changes.
  spacing:
    # Use a 'value' map so Quarto treats spacing as a single param object you can
    # edit from the YAML header (e.g., for rendering scripts or UI)
    value:
      # Base line height for body text (unitless; e.g., 1.35). Set to 1.5 to test increased spacing.
      body_line_height: 1.35
      # Bibliography line height and gap between entries
      bib_line_height: 1.25
      bib_gap: "0.12em"
      # List spacing (line-height, gap between list items)
      list_line_height: 1.6
      list_gap: "0.65em"
      list_item_gap: "0.35em"
      # Paragraph gap (bottom margin for <p>)
      paragraph_gap: "0.85em"
header-gseval: true

```{r}
#| echo: false
#| results: 'asis'

#| warning: false
#| label: inject-css-variables
# Inject CSS variables into the rendered HTML from params (editable via YAML).
# Note: this emits an HTML <style> tag intended for HTML output; when rendering to PDF via LaTeX the chunk still runs and will emit the same text (generally harmless). If you prefer this to be HTML-only, wrap the `cat(...)` call in a format check.
cat(sprintf('<style>:root{--cv-body-line-height:%s;--cv-bib-line-height:%s;--cv-bib-gap:%s;--cv-list-line-height:%s;--cv-list-gap:%s;--cv-list-item-gap:%s;--cv-paragraph-gap:%s;}</style>\n',
            params$spacing$value$body_line_height,
            params$spacing$value$bib_line_height,
            params$spacing$value$bib_gap,
            params$spacing$value$list_line_height,
            params$spacing$value$list_gap,
            params$spacing$value$list_item_gap,
            params$spacing$value$paragraph_gap))
```

```{r, eval=params$gseval}
#| label: gsecitationtable

foofoo <- foo <- gcite::gcite_user_info('TXeKxGsAAAAJ',verbose=FALSE,read_citations=FALSE)

gse_tbl <- as.data.frame(foofoo$citation_indices, stringsAsFactors = FALSE)

if("Since.2021" %in% names(gse_tbl)) names(gse_tbl)[names(gse_tbl)=="Since.2021"] <- "Since 2021"
if("All" %in% names(gse_tbl)) gse_tbl$All <- as.numeric(gse_tbl$All)
if("Since 2021" %in% names(gse_tbl)) gse_tbl$`Since 2021` <- as.numeric(gse_tbl$`Since 2021`)

if(knitr::is_latex_output()) {
  # Use kableExtra for PDF - has better centering support
  if(requireNamespace("kableExtra", quietly = TRUE)){
    library(kableExtra)
    gse_tbl %>%
      knitr::kable(format = "latex", booktabs = TRUE, 
                   format.args = list(big.mark = ","),
                   align = c("l", "c", "c")) %>%
      kable_styling(latex_options = "HOLD_position", 
                    position = "center",
                    full_width = FALSE)
  } else {
    pander::panderOptions('table.alignment.default',c('left','right','right'))
    pander::pander(foofoo$citation_indices)
  }
} else {
  # Use gt for HTML
  if(requireNamespace("gt", quietly = TRUE)){
    library(gt)
    gse_tbl %>%
      gt() %>%
      fmt_number(columns = intersect(c("All", "Since 2021"), names(gse_tbl)), decimals = 0, use_seps = TRUE) %>%
      cols_align(align = "left", columns = "index") %>%
      cols_align(align = "center", columns = intersect(c("All", "Since 2021"), names(gse_tbl))) %>%
      tab_options(
        table.font.size = px(13),
        column_labels.font.size = px(12),
        data_row.padding = px(8),
        heading.title.font.size = px(12),
        table.width = pct(50),
        table.align = "center"
      )
  } else {
    pander::panderOptions('table.alignment.default',c('left','right','right'))
    pander::pander(foofoo$citation_indices)
  }
}
```

```{r, eval=params$gseval}
require(ggplot2)
require(gridExtra)
require(scholar)
#plot1 <- qplot(1)

## Adjust for discrepancy in total (field All[1] in call to gcite)
adjust <- foo$citation_indices$All[1]-sum(foo$overall_citations$n_citations)
plot1 <- ggplot(foo$overall_citations,aes(x=year,y=n_citations))+
    geom_bar(stat='identity')+
    theme_bw()+
    xlab('Year')+
    ylab('Citations/Year')
plot2 <- ggplot(foo$overall_citations,aes(x=year,y=cumsum(n_citations)+adjust))+
    geom_bar(stat='identity')+
    theme_bw()+
    xlab('Year')+
    ylab('Cumulative Citations')
grid.arrange(plot1, plot2, ncol=2)    
```
